notes.text:
This update adds handling of SHA256 hashes to parts of the X509 Certificate 
classes in the C# implementation of Mono (bnc#871362) and improves handling 
of non-existing certificate revocation lists (bnc#810747, bnc#606002).
notes.title: Description of the patch

notes.text: The TLS stack in Mono before 3.12.1 allows man-in-the-middle attackers to conduct message skipping attacks and consequently impersonate clients by leveraging missing handshake state validation, aka a "SMACK SKIP-TLS" issue.

notes.text: The TLS stack in Mono before 3.12.1 makes it easier for remote attackers to conduct cipher-downgrade attacks to EXPORT_RSA ciphers via crafted TLS traffic, related to the "FREAK" issue, a different vulnerability than CVE-2015-0204.
